column4: does anyone know how i can get an asus usb n13 wireless adapter to work for 11.04? i have the installation disk but im not sure how to use the files provided...
does it say 'Linux' on the disc? :p
text in the menu
it is compatible, there is a folder titled "linux" i extracted the files, but i cant understand how to install the driver.... the readme is over my head
it's be pretty surprising if you don't already have the driver available to modprobe
maybe rt2800usb
im not sure what you mean
I mean when there are drivers for things, they're added to the kernel, you don't have to rely on random install discs
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Device/Asus%20USB-N13_Natty%2011.04
ok, ill try that.. it says something about n-band not working? thats the only reason i would need the driver
n _speed_ is what I remember reading
for a particular version
so it might not give you as fast a connection as it is physically able to, because of the driver, but it'll work
GNOME is pretty enormous even without that stuff

right, im using my internal wifi right now... i just got this so i would get faster internet... works awesome iin windows, but if it wont give me better speeds than b/g then i can just use the one im on now
well check
ok thanks
if it doesn't, what I'd do is check for a newer version that does
ok cool
or if both those drivers work for it, perhaps try the other one
same here, thanks for yo help
